isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - SUPPLEMENTAL DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS - DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS PROCEDURES - Lube Oil in Fuel

svcproc.title: Lube Oil in Fuel
svcproc.para: Possible causes for detecting lube oil in the fuel would include:

item.para: High pressure fuel / oil manifold gasket
Cracked or porous fuel / oil manifold

svcproc.para: If lube oil is suspected in the fuel, drain some fuel from the filter. If the fuel appears darker than it should be, get fuel sample from a supplier to compare with the fuel taken and check for contamination.

If a supplier sample is not available, remove the fuel filter, and use a filter cutter to cut open the housing. If the filter element is black, oil may have entered the fuel system, most likely past an injector O-ring or a missing O-ring.
